How do I use the `getcurrencyconverters` API to retrieve a list of currencies that meet certain liquidity and reserve ratio requirements, and what kind of information can I expect to receive from this API call?

The `getcurrencyconverters` API is a powerful tool that allows you to retrieve a list of currencies that meet specific liquidity and reserve ratio requirements. To use this API, you can run a command in the format of `verus -chain=VRSCTEST getcurrencyconverters <currency1> <currency2>`. This command will return a list of all currencies that have at least 1000 VRSC in reserve, a reserve ratio greater than 10% VRSC, and have all listed currencies as reserves.

For example, if you want to retrieve a list of currencies that have BTC/ETH markets at or above the liquidity threshold, you can run the command `verus -chain=VRSCTEST getcurrencyconverters btc eth`. This will return a list of all currencies that meet the specified requirements.

The `getcurrencyconverters` API is useful for identifying currencies that are liquid and have a strong reserve ratio, which can be important factors to consider when making investment decisions or evaluating the health of a currency. By using this API, you can gain valuable insights into the liquidity and reserve ratio of different currencies, and make more informed decisions as a result.

ueries
The `getcurrencyconverters` API retrieves all currencies that have at least 1000 VRSC in reserve, are greater than 10% VRSC reserve ratio, and have all listed currencies as reserves
- **E.g. BTC ETH:**
  ```
  verus -chain=VRSCTEST getcurrencyconverters btc eth
  ```
  Will return all currencies that have btc/eth markets at or above the liquidity threshold.
